article.headline: Fordham 58, Richmond 55
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Marcus Stout's layup with 2.4 seconds remaining Saturday boosted Fordham to a 58-55 victory over Richmond. Fordham (8-6, 1-1 Atlantic 10) started slowly in each half. It was 9-9 midway through the first half, and the Rams scored only six points in the first 10 minutes of the second half. The second-half cold spell allowed Richmond to build a nine-point lead on Dan Geriot's 3-pointer with 11:24 remaining. The Rams stormed back, taking a 50-49 lead on a Stout layup with 4:02 left. The Spiders (4-10, 0-1) took a 55-53 lead on Gaston Moliva's layup with 1:23 remaining, but Stout hit a pair of free throws and Richmond's Ryan Butler ran into traffic under the basket and turned the ball over with 28 seconds left. After Stout put the Rams ahead, the Spiders made a bad inbounds pass and Michael Binns hit one of two free throws to seal the victory. Stout matched his season high with 21 points, 18 in the second half. Bryant Dunston finished with 14 and Brenton Butler came off the bench to score 11. Geriot was the only Spider in double figures with 16.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
